website_summaries.verdict: For the same price as an iron, you can get this wrinkle-releaser that will fit in your carry on luggage.
pros: It's perfectly sized for steaming quick things, with each tank holding enough to steam about three items, and it heats up in about a minute
cons: The steam can get very hot, and it has also been known to leak

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING little product
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING little product! Super small. Works great! I like it better than my clunky 6 foot version. Ite asily fits in a carry-on or purse or even a larger sized dop kit. Perfect for those 3-5 day business trips or a 7-10 day outing where you want to double your socks and underwear but halve your shirts and pants. Add a small travel size 3oz. Wrinkle Releaser pre-spray and you are fresh and crisp in under a minute. I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are obsessed with this new steamer we bought a couple weeks ago. I bought a big expensive one about a year back and it recently stopped working so decided to give this a shot. Travels in a bag easily as we took it on vacation. Use it almost every morning and has taken the wrinkles out of any material you can think of quickly! Also - love that it gets hot so fast and is ready to use in less than a minute. I highly recommend this steamer!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little steamer!
customer_reviews.text: Nice little steamer! I use this to get out all of those annoying little wrinkles that don't quite come out in the dryer. It works as expected. It is small enough for travel, but works fine for every day use. It just as a limited water capacity, so you need to refill it if you need to steam more than a couple of articles.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Heats up quickly and does a great job! Just be sure to keep it parallel ...
customer_reviews.text: Heats up quickly and does a great job! Just be sure to keep it parallel to the ground when steaming so it doesn’t leak water. It gets out even heavy set in wrinkles, you just have to go over the spot a couple times. Great for traveling since it’s so compact. I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for blouses
customer_reviews.text: This is so much more convenient than a iron. This steamer was smaller than I expected, I to through about 4/5 shirts before I have to refill the water again. Also, do not fill it to the recommended line, put a little less or else it'll start spraying water everywhere. It's a decent steamer for the price, but it could be better
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Not a quality product
customer_reviews.text: I rarely give a bad review but this steamer worked for exactly one weekend getaway. When it did work, it got very hot and produced good steam. It hasn’t worked since. It’s almost as if the on/off switch doesn’t work anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Works moderately well, still get water bubbling out
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if it’s this clothing steamer or most of them but it works moderately well for me. I also get water bubbling out the end even when I haven’t filled it up completely and then I’ve had problems with some of my more delicate garments.
customer_reviews.author: HCM

customer_reviews.title: Major leak, unusable
customer_reviews.text: I am very confused abut the overwhelmingly positive reviews on this product. When using this for the first time, I filled up the reservoir, and water immediately began to leak from two holes in the bottom of the steamer. This was a rapid leak, so the steamer was essentially unusable, and I ended up with water all over the bathroom floor. I was able to get a refund from Amazon, but I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: tjbrown

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done for de-wrinkling work outfits
customer_reviews.text: I was not open to the idea of buying an iron so I went with the next best thing and bought this steamer. It is pretty small, but gets the job done when I need to quickly de-wrinkle a blouse and skirt/pants before work. It is a great size for travel, I can't wait to bring it on my next trip. Only note would be to make sure IT IS NOT POINTED DIRECTLY DOWNWARD when steaming, or else very hot water will fall out. If you can handle that then this is a great little steamer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great steamer
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic little steamer. As a single guy who doesn't own an iron, this sure beats throwing my work shirts back in the dryer when I didn't quite hang them in time. It's certainly hot enough that it will put a crease into my shirt sleeves.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for the price. Only minor nitpick is that the water compartment is very small and it doesn't steam for too long before you have to fill up the reservoir again, but I knew that going in. Plus the upside, of course, is how compact it is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Now I have a steamer at home and one in my motorhome. Wouldn't want to be without one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon amazon

customer_reviews.title: I love this little guy
customer_reviews.text: I can do two and a half shirts with a full tank and one pant/skirt. I love this little guy! It heats up very quickly and I've been using it for a few months now with no problems. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Jacinda

customer_reviews.title: Great little steamer good for travel used it for wedding
customer_reviews.text: Great little steamer good for travel used it for wedding
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad investment.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. Takes about 3 minutes to heat up and I can take care of getting wrinkles out of my clothes every morning before work. Not a bad investment.
customer_reviews.author: CWotEyeDidDere?

customer_reviews.title: It was the perfect size and worked great
customer_reviews.text: We used this for steaming a bridal veil. It was the perfect size and worked great. It would also work great for travel if you needed to take it with you.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: We just got back from a Viking River cruise and all of our clothes that got wrinkled in transit steamed out just great.
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this thing. We just got back from a Viking River cruise and all of our clothes that got wrinkled in transit steamed out just great.

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this steamer, lid does not close on right all the way. Drips easily, even when it's not past the line. Looking forward to returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Quite useful
customer_reviews.text: It's been a year since I have purchased this steamer and it still works well. The sufficient steam enables me to get one shirt or a dress down in a short time. Like this one, it's better than the one I bought before.

customer_reviews.title: I returned it.

customer_reviews.text: I love this little steamer. I take it with me whenever I have to go out of town. It is small so I usually have to fill the tank twice to get a whole garment steamed

customer_reviews.title: Quality, affordable steamer.
customer_reviews.text: Really satisfied with this steamer, especially for the price! In my experience, one fill is enough to steam about three clothing items. It's a lot more convenient than the iron, and non-damaging. 100% recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This steamer exceeded my expectations. Just took it on a cruise. It is small to pack in the suitcase and works well.

customer_reviews.title: ... a huge stand-up steamer but this one is even better and so easy to set up in the mornings ...
customer_reviews.text: We had a huge stand-up steamer but this one is even better and so easy to set up in the mornings before work. Gets hot super fast and works wonderfully!

customer_reviews.title: Best friend of silk and cashmere!

customer_reviews.title: BEST PRODUCT OF 2017
customer_reviews.text: This is my new favorite thing!! It's compact so I can take it/use it anywhere! The efficiency of the steaming is amazing, and does the same work that a larger/more expensive steamer can do!

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for college students!
customer_reviews.text: Works extremely well and super great for college students or anyone who needs to be on the go. A full tank is probably good enough for two shirts but it heats up within a minute so it's convenient

customer_reviews.title: Water boils and spills out
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually happy with amazon products but I have to give this one 1 star. The water spills out once it starts to boil, so by the the time it stops there is barely enough to steam clothes, tablecloths etc.

customer_reviews.author: Adolfo/Braudy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am totally disappointed in the steamer. It runs out of water to quickly and after you refill at it sputters all over the draperies. I wanted to send it back but I had disposed of the box and packing material.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna C. Regal

customer_reviews.title: Steam in 90 Seconds!!
customer_reviews.text: 90 seconds from cold to steam. This works so quickly because there isn't much of a reservoir in it. My first big job, I ran out of steam a few times and had to refill, but this isn't a big deal since I'm up and running again in under 90 seconds. Don't try and lay something flat and "pour" the steam onto your item - you'll just pour water on it. That's the limitation of this sort of thing, the steam goes up, so whatever you're steaming needs to be vertical for it to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Collins

customer_reviews.title: Great little steamer gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: This steamer works great for weekly steaming. We send many things to dry cleaning, but for those items that I was myself that need a bit of straightening out, this works great. It hold enough water for 1-2 pretty wrinkled items, but can easily be refilled and quickly reheats for continued use. It also works well for bedding (I have steamed the edges of my top sheet that fold over once my bed is made - a great way to make it look ironed when company is coming over!)
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Steamy
customer_reviews.text: Used it to steam some curtains that were pretty stiff and wrinkly they came out great! It takes awhile for rhe steam to build up but it does it's job. I've used it on laundry as well and it saves me lots of work from trying to dewrinkle them again (Sometimes though it will spurt out drops of water while its trying to build up steam.)
customer_reviews.author: JMichellex

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I am very well pleased with this little steamer. I especially like the fact that it will sit up on end when you need to pause in your steaming for a minute. I wear pretty much nothing but casual clothes and hated having to pull out the ironing board and set up the iron for one item. This way, I can heat it up and be do away with even tough wrinkles in nothing flat.
customer_reviews.author: Coffee LoverTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It's alright.
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough, wish I had bought a bigger size. I purchased this for my butter soft scrubs (uniform advantage) because they wrinkle like nobodies business in the wash. My only gripe is that I have to refill it pretty often when I have a lot of scrub sets to steam out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to iron !
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an alternative to using an iron because I hate having to lug around the ironing board and get that out every time I have to iron something. I really like this steamer, it does the job ! Only complaint is that it's kind of hard to use at first if you don't have a place to hand the clothes with enough room

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected plus it works great

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

And with the small price tag it really is worth the 5 stars

I followed the instructions of waiting to cool down to refill the water so it is going to take some time before you finish all the clothes you want to steam.
